00027 #include <iostream>
00028 
00029 // include everything garfeild needs
00030 #include <garfeild.h>
00031 
00032 // image loading and saving with OpenCV
00033 #include <highgui.h>
00034 
00035 using namespace std;
00036 
00037 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00038 {
00039         // model.png is the default model image file name.
00040         char *modelFile= "model.jpg";
00041 
00042         if (argc<2) {
00043                 cerr << "Usage: " << argv[0] 
00044                         << " [-m <model image>] <image> [<image> ...]\n";
00045                 return -1;
00046         }
00047 
00048         // search for model name
00049         for (int i=1; i<argc-1; i++) {
00050                 if (strcmp(argv[i], "-m") ==0) {
00051                         modelFile = argv[i+1];
00052                         break;
00053                 }
00054         }
00055 
00056         // Allocate the detector object
00057         planar_object_recognizer detector;
00058 
00059         // A lower threshold will allow detection in harder conditions, but
00060         // might lead to false positives.
00061         detector.match_score_threshold=.03f;
00062 
00063         detector.ransac_dist_threshold = 5;
00064         detector.max_ransac_iterations = 500;
00065         detector.non_linear_refine_threshold = 1.5;
00066         detector.min_view_rate=.2;
00067         detector.views_number = 100;
00068 
00069         // Train or load classifier
00070         if(!detector.build_with_cache(
00071                                 string(modelFile), // mode image file name
00072                                 400,               // maximum number of keypoints on the model
00073                                 32,                // patch size in pixels
00074                                 3,                 // yape radius. Use 3,5 or 7.
00075                                 16,                // number of trees for the classifier. Somewhere between 12-50
00076                                 3                  // number of levels in the gaussian pyramid
00077                                 ))
00078         {
00079                 cerr << modelFile << ": Error while loading model image or classifier!\n";
00080                 return -2;
00081         }
00082 
00083         // The detector is now ready. Load input images.
00084         for (int i=1; i<argc; ++i) {
00085                 if (argv[i][0] == '-') { ++i; continue; }
00086                 IplImage *im = cvLoadImage(argv[i],0);
00087                 if (!im) {
00088                         cerr << argv[i] << ": unable to load image.\n";
00089                         continue;
00090                 } 
00091                 if (detector.detect(im)) {
00092                         cout << argv[i] << ": detection succeeded!\n";
00093 
00094                         // save an image showing the result
00095                         IplImage *result = detector.create_result_image(im, false,true,false,true);
00096                         char fn[512]; sprintf(fn,"result_%s", argv[i]);
00097                         cvSaveImage(fn, result);
00098                         cvReleaseImage(&result);
00099                 } else {
00100                         cout << argv[i] << ": detection failed.\n";
00101                 }
00102         }
00103         return 0;
00104 }
